content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a case that has been ongoing for 22 years the final ruling upholds the claim of the plaintiffs who were involved in a dispute over a property the court declares that the property was transferred to the plaintiffs through a private deed in 1982 the court also acknowledges a transaction involving a bankruptcy trustee and declares the division of coownership shares as a result the court dissolves the community inheritance and assigns full ownership of two rustic properties to the eldest shareholder the court orders the eldest shareholder to pay the other shareholders a certain amount to adjust the division the court also addresses the validity of a private deed and the disputed allocation of shares throughout the trial there were various parties involved including heirs and bankruptcy trustees the court confirms the indivisibility of the disputed funds and determines their market value the court grants the plaintiffs claim and allocates the funds accordingly considering the shares of each party the court also addresses the payment of loss income and determines the legal costs of the trial in conclusion the court has made a definitive ruling in favor of the plaintiffs declaring their ownership of the property and ordering the defendant to reimburse the litigation costs the court also orders the transcription of the judgment and assigns the remaining costs to the defendant this decision was made by the bari council chamber civil section tribunal
